text:
Hi, I have a corporate client. They are currently running some of their branches on Drupal but wish to migrate business units to HubSpot CMS over the next year.
*The challenge*:  They want both Drupal and HubSpot CMS to co-exist on the same domain while the transition happens to launch fast.
*The question*: Is it possible AT ALL to do run HubSpot on a subfolder?
I don't believe so... unless there's some wizzardry I'm not aware of
you can do sub-domain I believe, but not both running on the root
I would go the sub-domain route if they’re open to it, that I know IS possible because I’ve inheritted a site that way - never set one up like that myself though.
They aren’t open to it. If anyone has any idea or guide or how to setup HubSpot with an SSL Reverse Proxy, please let me know.
by coincidence, today, i received a complaint about this being hidden in the advanced settings

Subdomain works no question about it. But if it is an absolute no no for them we've got one project in the past where our client wanted to use the reverse proxy method. It worked. But I remember there being some weird things that you gotta be ready for like if I recall correctly you gotta use the cnd2.HubSpot,net domain for all filemanager assets that you use on the site and such. And I remember there being some times when they had their reverse proxy setup going bonkers that caused issues on the site as well.
Is there anything on the roadmap you know about regarding multiple CMS instances on one domain so we don’t have to do the reverse proxy thing?
Yup, reverse proxies are absolutely not supported. URLs may not work and you could end blocking yourself because all the traffic coming through your proxy may appear to be abuse
Or one single CMS connected to multiple marketing licenses?

I'm not aware of anyone working on that or having that on their ideas list. It's an interesting idea, I'll pass it along

They are exploring what an "Enterprise" package CMS might look like... but this is very, very early stages. Just researching. That MIGHT include more functionality around multi-site... as I know many enterprise websites require multisite.
really minor feature request - upon signing in, and getting the myaccounts screen - auto-focus the search field :wink:
<@U7SL518D6> that would be a great feature if the developer extension was installed :slightly_smiling_face:

lol made me think - randomly display motivational text at the top of the screen with goofy references “LETS GET READY TO DEVLOOOOOOOOOOOP!”
“You take the blue pill - the story ends, you wake up in your bed and believe whatever you want to believe. You take the orange pill - you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.”
